Race.SpecificTitle: PW School District -- Local Option - Term Limits
Race.FullText:
"LOCAL OPTION ELECTION
Within West Carroll Parish School District:
Shall the number of terms of office that any member of the school board may serve be limited to three consecutive four-year terms?"

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Police Jury -- 1% S&U - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Sales & Use Tax Renewal)

Summary:  Renewal of a 1% sales and use tax for a period of 10 years with the proceeds thereof to be dedicated and used as follows: (1) 1/2 for general operating expenses of West Carroll Parish and (2) 1/2 for constructing and maintaining roads and bridges in said Parish.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of West Carroll, State of Louisiana (the "Parish") under the provisions of Article VI, Section 29 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to continue to levy and collect a tax of one percent (1%) (the "Tax") upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption and the storage for use or consumption of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the Parish, all as defined by law (an estimated $1,050,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for an additional period of ten (10) years, commencing May 1, 2013, with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax), to be dedicated and used for the following purposes: (1) one-half (1/2) for general operating expenses of the Parish; and (2) one-half (1/2) for constructing and maintaining drains and drainage facilities and for constructing and maintaining roads and bridges in the Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Oak Grove Prop. #1 -- 2.52 Mills - Mayor & TC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Town of Oak Grove Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 2.52 mills property tax continuation for operating and maintaining the municipal cemetery, a permanent public improvement.
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Oak Grove, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), levy a two and fifty-two hundredths (2.52) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in the Town (an estimated $25,200 expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of operating and maintaining the municipal cemetery, a permanent public improvement, said millage to represent a three hundredths of a mill (.03) increase over the 2.49 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2012 pursuant to an election held on October 5, 2002?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Oak Grove Prop. #2 -- 6.33 Mills - Mayor & TC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Town of Oak Grove Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 6.33 mills property tax continuation for maintaining and improving public streets and alleys within and for the Town of Oak Grove.
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Oak Grove, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), levy a six and thirty-three hundredths (6.33) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in the Town (an estimated $63,300 expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of maintaining and improving public streets and alleys within and for the Town, said millage to represent an eight hundredths of a mill (.08) increase over the 6.25 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2012 pursuant to an election held on October 5, 2002?
